posts.post_content:
This can be bypassed with cards like Future Sight that allow you to play the top card of your library and cards with flashback or can be played from your graveyard/any zone other than your hand as it won't trigger Possibility Storm.  
  
@Ansem717 : If the Forced Fruition's effect resolves before Possibility Storm's effect then the player draws 7, then resolves Possibility Storm's effect. Then, after the second spell is put on the stack, a second trigger for Forced Fruition is put on the stack forcing the player to draw 7 more cards. New Forced Fruition triggers cannot be resolved until the current effect is completely resolved which means the exiled cards will have been put back into the library.  
  
The two possible orders for the effects are:  
  
Player casts initial spell  
---  
Possibility Storm trigger  
Forced Fruition trigger  
---  
Possibility Storm trigger  
Forced Fruition resolves, player draws 7 cards  
---  
Possibility Storm resolves, player casts a spell off Possibility Storm  
---  
Player's ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This can be bypassed with cards like Future Sight that allow you to play the top card of your library and cards with flashback or can be played from your graveyard/any zone other than your hand as it won't trigger Possibility Storm.

@Ansem717 : If the Forced Fruition's effect resolves before Possibility Storm's effect then the player draws 7, then resolves Possibility Storm's effect. Then, after the second spell is put on the stack, a second trigger for Forced Fruition is put on the stack forcing the player to draw 7 more cards. New Forced Fruition triggers cannot be resolved until the current effect is completely resolved which means the exiled cards will have been put back into the library.

The two possible orders for the effects are:

Player casts initial spell
---
Possibility Storm trigger
Forced Fruition trigger
---
Possibility Storm trigger

---
Possibility Storm resolves, player casts a spell off Possibility Storm

posts.post_content:
How does this work with [Forced Fruition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forced Fruition)? So let's say my opponent has only two Artifacts in her deck. One is in her hand, and the other is the last card in her library. How does the scenario play out if she casts the one in her hand?  
  
1) She casts the artifact in her hand. Forced Fruition resolves before Storm, so she draws 7 cards. Then she exiles cards from the top of her library until she finds the other artifact, at the bottom of the deck. She casts that artifact and, before Possibility Storm finishes resolving, she draws 7 cards to Forced Fruition and looses (Since her library is currently exiled).  
  
2) She casts the artifact in her hand. Forced Fruition resolves before Storm, so she draws 7 cards. Then she exiles cards from the top of her library until she finds the other artifact, at the bottom of the deck. She casts that artifact, and since she's casting a spell in the middle of the resolution of another ability, Forced Fruition will wait until Possibility S... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
How does this work with Forced Fruition? So let's say my opponent has only two Artifacts in her deck. One is in her hand, and the other is the last card in her library. How does the scenario play out if she casts the one in her hand?

1) She casts the artifact in her hand. Forced Fruition resolves before Storm, so she draws 7 cards. Then she exiles cards from the top of her library until she finds the other artifact, at the bottom of the deck. She casts that artifact and, before Possibility Storm finishes resolving, she draws 7 cards to Forced Fruition and looses (Since her library is currently exiled).

2) She casts the artifact in her hand. Forced Fruition resolves before Storm, so she draws 7 cards. Then she exiles cards from the top of her library until she finds the other artifact, at the bottom of the deck. She casts that artifact, and since she's casting a spell in the middle of the resolution of another ability, Forced Fruition will wait until Possibility S... (see all)

posts.post_content:
In addition to being as fun as anything, this card can actually be played fairly competitively if you build your deck right.  
  
Certain cards will benefit from you casting spells, regardless of whether or not they resolve, so having this out will essentially get you a double effect for them. As Rootkit9208 already said, [Nivix Cyclops](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nivix Cyclops) and [Guttersnipe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guttersnipe) and [Talrand, Sky Summoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Talrand, Sky Summoner) are all very powerful with Possibility Storm on the field, but there are even more options available. [Young Pyromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Young Pyromancer) and [Door of Destinies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Door of Destinies), for example.  
  
Outside of the Izzet Guild, you can play Possibility Storm with the Orzhov in order to get more extortion opportunities. This helps the Orzhov a lot, because Black/White doesn't have a huge amount of draw power in Standard at the moment.  
  
Dimir's infamous [Consuming Aberration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consuming Aberration) can also get double triggers if you feel like playing Grixis Mill... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
In addition to being as fun as anything, this card can actually be played fairly competitively if you build your deck right.

Certain cards will benefit from you casting spells, regardless of whether or not they resolve, so having this out will essentially get you a double effect for them. As Rootkit9208 already said, Nivix Cyclops and Guttersnipe and Talrand, Sky Summoner are all very powerful with Possibility Storm on the field, but there are even more options available. Young Pyromancer and Door of Destinies, for example.

Outside of the Izzet Guild, you can play Possibility Storm with the Orzhov in order to get more extortion opportunities. This helps the Orzhov a lot, because Black/White doesn't have a huge amount of draw power in Standard at the moment.

Dimir's infamous Consuming Aberration can also get double triggers if you feel like playing Grixis Mill... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Play with cascade.  
Cast [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf). Its cascade trigger goes on the stack, as well as [Possibility Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Possibility Storm)'s trigger. [Possibility Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Possibility Storm) gives you, I don't know, [Maelstrom Wanderer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstrom Wanderer), which then cascades two more times, giving you a net of a [Maelstrom Wanderer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstrom Wanderer) and 3 cascade triggers, all for 2RG.
posts.html:
Play with cascade.
Cast Bloodbraid Elf. Its cascade trigger goes on the stack, as well as Possibility Storm's trigger. Possibility Storm gives you, I don't know, Maelstrom Wanderer, which then cascades two more times, giving you a net of a Maelstrom Wanderer and 3 cascade triggers, all for 2RG.
